text: Nicola Taisir Hanna (born September 19, 1961)Lawyer Central.com profile is an American lawyer currently serving as the United States Attorney for the Central District of California. ==Education== Hanna received his Bachelor of Arts from the University of California, San Diego and his Juris Doctor, magna cum laude, from Georgetown University Law Center. ==Legal career== Prior to becoming a U.S. Attorney, he was a partner at Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher, where he specialized in white-collar criminal matters and complex commercial litigation. Hanna previously served as an Assistant United States Attorney in Los Angeles from 1990 to 1995, where he prosecuted major drug trafficking and money laundering organizations, as well as violent and economic crimes. From 1995 to 1998, he served as an Assistant United States Attorney in San Diego, where he focused on investigating and prosecuting international drug cartels. ==Nomination to be U.S. Attorney== On April 19, 2018, his nomination was reported out of committee by a voice vote.Results of Executive Business Meeting – April 19, 2018, Senate Judiciary Committee His nomination was confirmed by voice vote on April 26, 2018. ==References== Category:1961 births Category:Living people Category:Assistant United States Attorneys Category:California lawyers Category:Georgetown University Law Center alumni Category:University of California, San Diego alumni Category:20th-century American lawyers Category:21st-century American lawyers Category:United States Attorneys for the Central District of California Category:American people of Arab descent Category:People associated with Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher
title: Nicola T. Hanna
